TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit X509IssuerSerial extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: Represents the <> element of an XML digital signature.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The X509IssuerSerial structure represents the `<X509IssuerSerial`> element of an XML digital signature defined by the XML digital signature specification. The `<X509IssuerSerial`> element is the subelement of the <`X509Data`> element that contains an X.509v3 certificate issuer's distinguished name and serial number pair. The distinguished name and serial number pair help identify a specific X.509v3 certificate.
The issuer of an X.509 certificate is the name of the certification authority that issued the certificate. Certification authorities assign each certificate they issue a unique serial number for identification purposes.
Use the X509IssuerSerial structure to specify a certificate issuer's distinguished name and serial number pair when using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data> class. You can add an X509IssuerSerial structure to the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data> class using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data.IssuerSerials%2A> property. Alternatively, you can add string values that represent the X.509 certificate issuer's distinguished name and serial number pair using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyInfoX509Data.AddIssuerSerial%2A> method.
For more information about the `<X509IssuerSerial`> element, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to sign and verify an XML document using an X.509 certificate from a certificate store. This example saves key information to the signed document using the X509IssuerSerial object.
[!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.crypto_12_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.crypto_12_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an X.509 certificate issuer's distinguished name.
Docs.value: An X.509 certificate issuer's distinguished name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The IssuerName property represents an X.509 certificate issuer's distinguished name specified in the `<X509IssuerSerial`> element.
For more information about the `<X509IssuerSerial`> element, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to sign and verify an XML document using an X.509 certificate from a certificate store. This example saves key information to the signed document using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial> object.
[!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.security.crypto_21_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.security.crypto_21_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an X.509 certificate issuer's serial number.
Docs.value: An X.509 certificate issuer's serial number.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SerialNumber property represents an X.509 certificate issuer's serial number specified in the `<X509IssuerSerial`> element.
For more information about the `<X509IssuerSerial`> element, see the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to sign and verify an XML document using an X.509 certificate from a certificate store. This example saves key information to the signed document using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.X509IssuerSerial> object.
